column4: :( just installed the updates and pressed cancel when I was asked if want to keep or overwrite the old version. Thought that would stop the installation but the pakets are gone from my update list. (linux-image-2.6.28-13-generic which popped up something about debconfig oder something; another one (dunno which( popped up menue.lst or something)?
now I got an error report that linux-image-2.6.28-13-generic could not be installed
does it show up in: dpkg -l | grep linux-image
do you need the new kernel?
what is it good for?
is your system running on all cylinders and all hardware running ok?
yes, for this mashine. All cylinders = cpu cores?
shows up: iF  linux-image-2.6.28-13-generic              2.6.28-13.44
just a colloquiualism for everything runnin ok. if its all ok you have no reason at all to install the new kernel
then run:  sudo apt-get --purge remove linux-image-2.6.28.13-generic; sudo apt-get --purge autoremove; sudo apt-get clean
thank you!
if your system is running you do not have to get the new kernel.
if some of your harware needs the new kernel to run, then get it otherwise theres no benefit at all
no performance improvements either?
you can check whats new to see if the new one benefits you.
ok, Ill do that for me EEE-PC. I have some issues there
it may help. i even talked to a guy who needed the .30kernel for jaunty to make suff nice
tried a different theme?
It just appear some times and not just vlc and not on the startup of the GUI, I don't know what triggers it
i'd ask in #compiz
k
thanks, now I have k3b :)
